title: What is Quantum Psychology and how does it relate to observer-created reality and Deep Trance Phenomenon?
first_phrase: This text explores the impact of Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle on modern physics and the philosophical interpretations it has given rise to. The author, Nick Herbert, identifies eight different schools of thought in the scientific community, including the Copenhagen interpretation, which is the center point of Quantum Psychology. In this interpretation, there is no reality in the absence of observation and observation creates reality. This has led to the idea that consciousness alters the world itself, as our subjective experience is observer-created. The text concludes by suggesting that we, as the knowers of our experience, have an active influence on the reality we experience.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the observer-created reality theory suggests that we are the knowers of our experience, and our consciousness alters the world around us. This theory has practical applications in therapy, where recognizing and understanding Deep Trance Phenomena can help individuals overcome their symptoms and create positive change in their lives.
